p.seg: [There was an eclipse (in the state of Qi),
the duke went to] the altar,
Xi Peng and Bao Shuya followed [him].
When the eclipse came,
the duke asked the two daifu:
"the eclipse, why is it?"
Bao Shuya answered:
"It is an anomalous change, a disaster."
He said:
“For Qi [...]
(?) said too many.
Bao Shuya answered:
“A disaster will come,
and when there will be a military threat,
and there will be a sickness upon your person.”
The duke said:
“But can it be avoided by means of the shuo ritual?”
Xipeng said:
“The duke is lawless,
isn’t it possible that he will not convert to what is good
and (instead) escape it?”
The duke said:
“How excessive, my unreliability!
But you should not blame me and get angry with me,
to the point of causing the eclipse (=blaming me for the eclipse).”
Bao Shuya and Xi Peng said:
"It is our fault.
In the past when Gaozong (Yin Gaozong殷高宗= Wu Ding 武丁) was offering a sacrifice
there were a male and female pheasant in front of the wine vessel.
He summoned Zuyi (?)
and asked him:
saying:
"Why is this?"
Zuyi answered:
"In the past the former lords told the king (Pan Geng 盤庚):
"If Heaven is not manifesting disasters,
and the Earth is not producing monsters [if you (misbehave but) don’t get warnings from nature-],
then tell the ghosts and spirits:
"Heaven and Earth clearly have abandoned me,
the ministers close by do not admonish me,
and those afar do not criticize me,
then I will tour the xiang and li [to get advice from the people]."
Now here to sacrifice to them [=the spirits?],
is something that will bring good fortune.
Offer them [the birds?] in sacrifice to xx,
and after you have made the sacrifice,
thereby reform the law of the former kings."
Gaozong ordered the xx to offer them [the birds] in sacrifice.
Once performed the sacrifice,
he ordered to enact the laws of the former kings.
He promulgated the old rules,
enacted the old deeds.
Those who rejected the (old) deeds would die,
those who would not enact them would die.
Within three years,
seven hundred states of the Di people came to pay allegiance.
Thereby he was able to follow the good
and to abandon the wrong."
The duke said:
“I didn’t know that it [=my way of ruling] wasn’t good.
Now inside I have not gotten [the allegiance of] the people,
outside I am derided by the feudal lords.”
My unworthiness,
how could it not be the worry of you two?
Xi Peng and Bao Shuya both kowtowed,
then they rose and said:
“The duke does not follow the proper path;
embracing his favorite Hua Mengzi
he gallops in the court of Ni,
he hastens to pursue hunting
and has no restraint.
Xi Peng and Bao Shuya both kowtowed,
then they rose and said:
“The duke does not follow the proper path;
embracing his favorite Hua Mengzi
he gallops in the court of Ni,
he hastens to pursue hunting
and has no restraint.
The inferior officials all rejoice in hunting,
strongly covetous and twice more avid,
wearing out the state of Qi.
Daily they indulge in their carelessness,
not caring about what precedes them or follows them,
so that the common people all resent them and hate them,
and [the state] will quickly be lost.
If you do not get rid of them,
even if we ministers want to make reprimands
we will not obtain an audience.
Have you not observed
that in the nature of man there are three things:
food, sexual desire and rest.
Now Shudiao is a mediocre man
that wants to know (?) a state of ten thousand chariots
and bring it to disaster,
the calamities brought by him are deep indeed;
Yayi is a perverse man
and feeds upon people,
his inhumanity is deep indeed.
If you do not make plans about it,
this will necessarily bring you harm.”
The duke said:
"If this is the case, then what should I do?"
Baoshuya answered:
"The people of Qi utterly dislike death,
and yet the ones above kill them with their extreme punishments;
they utterly desire food
and those above increase their taxes;
they utterly dislike exertion
and those above have untimely corvee’.
The duke then personally ordered the officials in charge of the sacrifice
so that the sacrificial robes should not be adorned,
the implements must be simple and clean,
they must not use defective implements,
the sacrificial animals and the precious jades must be wholly as in antiquity,
and they must be approached with respect.
Then he instructed the officials in charge of the official documents
to exempt the old and weak from the punishments;
to measure the official acres with a short rope
and the private fields with a long rope [so to give advantage to the public and not to the state],
to take one zhong for one hundred shi;
to repair the roads in the ninth month,
the bridges to walk on in the tenth month,
the bridges for carriages in the eleventh month. ????
Then he ordered all the officials:
"The Xia chose officials only looking at their appearance,
and that's why they reached their end,
as all would take on a false appearance.
The reason why the Yin [=Shang] replaced them,
[is that] they observed both their appearance
and their words.
Overall, the reason why they disappeared
is that they faked (both) their appearance
and their words.
The reason why the Zhou replaced them
is that they observed their appearance,
listened to their words,
and examined the officials that were truthful.
Overall, the reason why they declined and fell
is that they forgot to examine their truthfullness.
As you exort me,
I will examine their truthfulness.
